bio.full: Jamie is a Mechanical Engineering student with industry experience from internships at Mytra Inc. (warehouse robotics), Navier Boat (electric hydrofoiling), and BETA Technologies (eVTOL aerospace). He brings expertise in mechanical design, verification & validation, and systems integration from designing cyclic loading fixtures, high voltage power distribution units, and aerospace demonstration systems. Jamie originally conceived the DRIP acoustic deposition concept and leads its technical development.

Emma specializes in materials science and chemical processes for the DRIP system. She focuses on optimizing material properties and understanding the chemical interactions during the high-temperature deposition process.

Addy is a junior majoring in mathematics, with a focus on theoretical computer science. He has extensive experience in computer graphics and simulation through working on various projects in his free time.
responsibilities: Build simulation for testing and verification

bio.full: Ryota Sato is pursuing a B.S. in Electrical Engineering with a focus on audio signal processing and an M.S. in Computer Science specializing in artificial intelligence. He has worked across industry-leading audio and engineering teams, including Yamaha's Research & Development division in Japan and Tesla's Audio DSP team, where he contributed to cutting-edge audio technology. His current research integrates his passion for guitar, focusing on reducing aliasing artifacts in temporal convolutional neural networks used to emulate vintage analog tube amplifiers. He also works on embedded edge audio systems, specializing in model pruning and quantization techniques to deploy low-latency neural audio models on constrained embedded architectures.
responsibilities: Develops advanced beamforming algorithms for acoustic object manipulation
Designs and implements acoustic hardware stack
Develops custom audio boards and embedded firmware
Controls high-density transducer arrays with precision and in real-time

bio.full: Weston handles the power electronics and control systems for the DRIP project. He designs the high-power circuits needed for the induction heating system and integrates all electrical subsystems.

openPositions.description: Design mechanical systems and fixtures for the acoustic deposition platform
requirements: Proficiency in SolidWorks or similar CAD
responsibilities: Coordinate with machine shop for fabrication
